website_summaries.verdict: The perfect fly reel for beginners as well as experienced anglers looking for a backup reel.
pros: Sturdily built for its price point
Drag adjustment settings are very accurate
Has the function, fit, and feel of much more expensive fly reels
cons: Drag threading and tension are a bit loose, making it too easy to accidentally knock the drag down to the free spool setting
Inside of reel is machined roughly

customer_reviews.title: OK but drag wont stay
customer_reviews.text: I've been flyfishing for more than 30 decades and have guided for multiple years. I don't get too excited about flyfishing reels especially for trout. Reels are just to hold line so I thought I would try this reel. The drag and reeling seem smooth but after reeling in line the drag system loosens up. So when you try to strip line off it again it backlashes since the drag loosened. Get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Fishsqueezer102

customer_reviews.title: Dropped and Broke
customer_reviews.text: Used this reel exactly one time and while putting my gear away, the reel slipped out of my hand and dropped onto the ground. Broke the retrieve handle off at the attachment point. Wrote the company for some ideas on how to fix this or buy a replacement part and got nothing back. Just asking for information and help. Guess too much to ask. One flippin time and broke. Totally disappointed. Will update if things change but for now....one star.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Bad drag system and Low line capacity
customer_reviews.text: Best to pass on this one. The reel does not have spool capacity for 100 yards or backing and a full fly line. The drag system is really bad. It frequently loosens and randomly freewheels causing a nasty birdsnest/backlash. I exchanged feedback with the seller concerning the capacity issue. Their response was "sorry about that but we'll increase it on the next version". No offer to exchange. You know I purchased this because it is a good looking reel and looks sweet on my rod... better than a name brand black unit. However functionally it is junk.
customer_reviews.author: David Hill

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly made product. Broke my thumb
customer_reviews.text: This product is poorly made. I have 2 of these and the crank handle has snapped off on both of them within 2 days use. Don’t purchase this Chinese made garbage broke my thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: lots of reel for $85 bucks and i will say it is far superior to the okuma slvs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this reel in a 10 WT for salmon fishing in the Salmon river in Pulaski New York. Anyone who fishes the salmon run knows how much of a beating your reel takes hooking 15 to 25 pound kings in ridiculous current. I use to run Okuma SLVS but wanted to try something else. I can tell you that this reel held up with no issues what so ever. This reel has a lot more drag in it then i excepted! I dunked the reel a few times and had no issues with the drag slipping. lots of reel for $85 bucks and i will say it is far superior to the okuma slvs.
customer_reviews.author: joe m.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I’m the guy that has no shortage of fly reels and rods. In other words, I’m a gear junkie. I’ve been thinking about getting one if these for a while but was afraid of the import name. I’m practical in that a reel is pretty much a line holder till I get up to my 8wt Lamson for Michigan salmon & steelhead and then I use the drag. I have Pfluegers, Lamson’s, Cabelas RLS and Cabelas Prestige Premier reels and this Piscifun is as good as any of them. It has a great finish, it’s super smooth turning and the drag is smooth, strong and no bumps. For the money, you can’t beat it and I recommend getting one.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H.

customer_reviews.title: Performs well
customer_reviews.text: I used this a lot and just ordered another one for a different rod. There is a lot of hype for reels, fly fishing doesn't have to be wicked expensive this reel works great, I do wish they had more colors in their large arbor style I would have rather had that but for a mid-arbor this is great it does everything its supposed to. Save money and buy this reel and use the money you saved to buy a very good quality fly line to go with it, you'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight, reels smoothly
customer_reviews.text: It is a nicely constructed reel. Some of the edges might be better if they were rounded off a bit ....... but that is a personal preference ..... not a defect. It's very lightweight .. I had intended to use it as a Spey reel but being this light weight I would have to add some lead tape (to balance when in the rod) or leave it as a regular fly reel.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Solid reel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to pair up with an Riverruns 6'6" rod, the green accents on the reel match up nicely. Reel feels very solid and well constructed, I'm quite impressed by the finish. Spooled w/50yds of Aventik 25lb backing and 85' of Aventik WF3F fly line, cast like a dream. So far adjustable drag is nice and smooth. Can't wait to fish with this little gem.
customer_reviews.author: Shrekoutdoors

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed and an excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this spool to go with my Piscufin 6wt rod with WF6F line with the Anglatech 7ft tapered sinking leader. Used this setup Sunday on the river with great results for warmwater species that were deeper in the water due to the current season temps. I caught Shad, Crappie and White Bass with this setup and the reel performed flawlessly. Line came off the spool very easily and the drag knob provided great incremental changes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great fly reel for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, I am very happy with the craftsmanship. As stated by other reviewers, the drag is easy to accidentally move to a different setting. However, for this price I have no complaints on that aspect. Having flyfished a number of years before and then just getting back into it, I am happy to have a drag on a reel that I can afford; I never had that luxury before. This appears to be a reel that will be durable, and it is definitely a good looking design. Can’t wait to try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Avril Tor

customer_reviews.title: Smooth like butter and built to last!
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say I'm a beginner at fly fishing. With that being said man I'm digging this reel more and more I use it! I paired this up with the 8'6 4wt sword rod from piscifun. These two combined make for a great beginner set up. It's nothing that won't break the bank and you don't have to give up quality in the process. The drag knob is easy to use and works great. I havent had any problems with this reel everyrhing seems rock solid. On my second day out I put it to the test with some bass, crappie, trout, perch, and a few striped bass. I defiantly will be getting another reel for sure.
customer_reviews.author: RedFox

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel considering the price point.
customer_reviews.text: Being relatively new to fly fishing I was in the market for a reel that would be compatible with an 8 weight fly rod my son gave to me. After a bit of research I had an idea of what I wanted and a budget for what I was willing to spend. Upon receipt of this reel I was pleasantly surprised at its quality and performance. Once again, being a newbie to fly fishing, my knowledge is limited but this reel far surpasses three other reels in rod/reel combo kits I have purchased. Thus far extremely satisfied. I will update when I finally get it out on the water and do some fly fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good Bang for the Buck.
customer_reviews.text: I put this reel on a CTS 4 Wt Quartz Glass rod that I built, and it works great. The reel is lined with SA Mastery WF4F and 20lb backing, I need to get another spool for it. The finish on the reel is polished black, and there are no scratches or finish marks on the surface. The drag is smooth and start up is also smooth. It is a great reel for panfish and small trout rods.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Daddy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little real at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little real at a great price. I just got back from the High Sierras and this thing worked out great. I've trout fished my whole life but never fly fished. I fished Bishop Creek and Upper Owens and this thing was amazing. I can see where the drag issue may be a problem on the bigger reals but the 3/4 size wasn't a problem at all. Stream fishing for trout you don't mess with your drag that much. For the price this thing is amazing. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Descent
customer_reviews.text: The drag on these is super hard to get right and gets stuck easily. The drag will be too tight and I’ll loosen it and no play and I’ll loosen it more and then the fish is running down the river. Tighten it back up a bit and snap off comes the fish. I’ve lost a number of salmon messing with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ellingson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, quiet drag.
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a 7’6” 3 weight fly rod that I want to use for panfish and stocked trout. For my application, I will probably never have to utilize the drag on a running fish; the reel will mostly just be there to hold the line. The reel looks great, is very lightweight and is much quieter and smoother to use than the reels that came with my combo fly rods.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Great Looks and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Took this reel out on opening day, my budy a long time fly fisherman,whom only buys Orvis bought a brand new $200 reel that weekend, then he tried my Piscifun Sword reel on my TFO Rod and was amazed. The drag system worked flawlessly and the real performed as well if not better than his brand-new orvis.😂 I paid $50 For this reel,and I just ordered a spare spool which I should receive tomorrow. Great product. I am buying a new 8wt rod this spring and you know what reel I will buy, another Piscifun Sword.
customer_reviews.author: Seldon Essex

customer_reviews.title: One of best values on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with the looks, feel and quality of this product. I am going to use it in November and cant wait. If I find that this reel is as good or better than an orvis, sage, hardy or other competitive reel, I will tell all my friends to shift over to this product, as the price, shipping and other elements have been exceptional
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Saenz

customer_reviews.title: These reels have held up great for the past three years
customer_reviews.text: I now own six of these reels, four I use for salt water fishing. First purchased a couple 9/10 reels to replace reels left behind on a trip to Florida. These reels have held up great for the past three years, no corrosion and good drag system.
customer_reviews.author: NORMAN L. BROOKS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Reel BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I Reely like this reel but the only think that keeps it from 5-stars is the drag adjustment detent system is too light, IMHO. It needs to have more positive "clicks" that stay in place. The drag "clutch" is also too "on-or-off" and needs to have a more adjustable range. Other than those two issues I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Jo

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel but poor drag design
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, feels solid, and is very smooth! Only complaint and it drastically affected performance is the drag system. It is kind of all or nothing I guess you could say. Very difficult to fine tune and when you do get it set close it moves constantly. I haven't yet found a way to tighten it so the knob stays put.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reel!
customer_reviews.text: Times have changed, and there is not only room for those old fancy handcrafted reels any more. Those ones, by the way, that are extremly expensive, and you only can find them in obscure and boring colors. When I first saw the piscifun sword reel, I instantly got amazed with it's pink shiny tone, entirely modern and revolutionary. Moreover, I've tried mine on extreme conditions, catching big trouts at Jurassic lake in southern Argentina, and as a result I found it versatile, effective, capable to endure heavy climate conditions, and finally something nice to admire while you are fishing, due to it's innovative break-paradigms colors.
customer_reviews.author: F. Grotzer

customer_reviews.title: I have owned all the best fly fishing reels
customer_reviews.text: I have owned all the best fly fishing reels, including Abels, Lamson Waterworks, Tibor, and even Charlton. but I will prob never buy them again. This Piscifun reel is unbelievable quality for the price. Great craftsmanship, comfort in the hand and very smooth drag. Esp for trout fishing, this is a no brainer. Now I get to spend even more money on the fly rods, knowing I got a top notch reel for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nicer than expected
customer_reviews.text: I don't believe in spending a lot of money on a fly reel - particularly for my smaller rod (3WT) which I use for short distance, small-stream fishing. Though I do value quality. This reel (I have the 3/4 WT model) is very nice. Looks great, works great - and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Lefevers

customer_reviews.title: Great reel!
customer_reviews.text: Great reel and ultra smooth. Maybe its just me or my copy of the reel but the drag is very sensitive. 1 or 2 clicks from free spool and the drag is on where you have to force pulling the line out when casting. Other than that I'm happy with it. Will be purchasing a 5/6wt in the near future. Can't beat that well priced reel.
customer_reviews.author: Boost

customer_reviews.title: Good reel for the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this reel and liked it well enough to purchase a second one. Pretty good reel for the money. I do have to say this reel is not the quality of say an Orvis reel of which I have two of those, however they are $50 less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A nice machined reel, but ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice looking machined reel, with very competitive price. I pair it with a St. Croix Rio Santo 5 weight rod, and have been totally satisfied with its performance, including its drag holding power, for a few weeks, until this morning. An all of sudden pull this morning knocked the drag off completely, not only the line went off a few feet freely, but a third of the line in reel also got loosen. After reset it had no problem in next hour's fishing. I hope it is just an occasional case, though I cannot find any reason why it happened. If it happens again I'll contact the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Go fishing, Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect light weight fly reel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 7' 3 weight rod I plan to use in Montana this summer. Reel is well balanced, craftsmanship appears to be very good. Very happy with the purchase, highly recommend this reel. Hopefully I'll catch a lot of fish.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Honey

customer_reviews.title: Spool not easily removed
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these, which says, "yes I'd buy another". But, The spools are not easily removed and in the event you get leader/tippet wound somewhere unpleasant, it takes a few minutes to remedy. Good drag. Good weight. Good click-not obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Piscifun Sword Reel
customer_reviews.text: I don't give anyone 5 stars but this reel come close. I'll wait and see how it stands up over the long haul before i give it the 5th star. It's a nice-looking reel and comes at a great price. I have reels in the Orvis CFO class and this reel competes in my world. I would like some clicking noise on retrieve but a minor point. If I'm reeling in a fish, I can't possibly miss the click. Doesn't have a lot of thread to fasten the spool but may be enough.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Maestas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 9/10 version to chase carp and northern pike. The price-point was outstanding and the reel is well made and very functional. This reel is going to be exactly what I need without spending a ton of money.
customer_reviews.author: OldNorCalGuy

customer_reviews.title: Reel worked great on trip to the Everglades
customer_reviews.text: Bought this reel and a Piscifun rod when a major fishing company messed up my order and I needed a 4 wt outfit for a trip. Reel worked great on trip to the Everglades. It is a great reel for the money and after using this outfit for several days cancelled the other order since this was all the reel and rod I needed and I feel it will stand up to my regular use for years. A machined reel for this price is an outstanding value.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C.

customer_reviews.title: Speed of delivery
customer_reviews.text: Everything was as expected in shipping, beautiful feel and color is fantastic!!! I have the green. Will not be using this until April when we go to Belize for some salt water fishing!! Very excited to use in April We have since returned from our trip from Belize as you can see I was very successful at catching a few fish!! The guide we hired was equally impressed with my new reel and rod. This is a approximately 17lb cobia caught with your reel!! No problems with handling this fish!!! We were looking for some large Tarpon, but we never came across any... Maybe next time, loved my new reel!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Hall

customer_reviews.title: Flawless Piece of Machinery
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the Reel and a spare spool. After 25 years on the river in Kodiak Alaska my old fly reel gave up. I looked a long time before replacing the old one with the Piscifun Sword 3/4 I use for Trout and dollies. It was delivered sooner than expected and I think it is gorgeous. Next day I limited out. They were right... the drag is flawless and silky smooth. No break-off using a 2lb tippet. Just let them run and the rod and drag do the work.
customer_reviews.author: doohough

customer_reviews.title: Good deal. Worked well first time out.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This is my third reel from Piscifun. Good products; good value. Follow up. Took the new reel out yesterday and hit a nice wild trout stream in the NC mountains where I could social distance and get some fresh air and exercise. The reel worked really well. And I caught 9 rainbows and browns.
customer_reviews.author: spike22a

customer_reviews.title: Great reels!
customer_reviews.text: Another great reel! I bought this 5/6 for my wife and is another fine reel. I only gave it 4 stars for the machining on the spool has sharp edges compared to my 7/8 reels. However rigorous testing with the backing and fly line it has not damaged either line. Compared to other high end cnc reels these perform as good if not better. The drag works well with no complaints. I bought this reel after using the 7/8s for a saltwater trip and was extremely impressed with the durability and how smooth the reel and drag performed. Changing from right to left handed was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I've beat the crap out of this thing and havm5 had an issue yet. She's been salty and sandy and tumbled around the back of my truck and absolutely no problems...yet lol. If something happens to this one I'll definitely get another. Excellent smooth drag. Holds alot of line.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick coy

customer_reviews.title: So far I am very happy with this reel
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with this reel. It is extremely smooth and the drag adjustment works well. I haven't used any high end reels to compare this too, but I dont see what else I would need. I fish for trout in the yellowstone river and surrounding places so I just strip them in anyway. I thought this reel was so nice I am going to give one of their spinning reels a try.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Great value + Spare spool available
customer_reviews.text: Spare spool found under "Piscifun Fly Fishing Reel". Reel works as described. I had to reverse the bearing it came set for right handed reeling. I am a right but prefer to reel with left hand. Watched YouTube video . when unspooling line from reel there is no option (that I have found yet) to turn ratcheting on or off. Currently there is no ratchet. It is silent. Overall appearance is really nice. There is a little play between the spool and its axle; however, it is not significant especially for what we paid. With the availability of the spare spool for $25 this is a really nice bargan. Items were delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: bongiojf

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight and High Performing
customer_reviews.text: This reel is perfect for the intermediate fly fisherman looking to diversify their arsenal and apply their knowledge to hone in their craft. The adjustable drag makes it simpler to quickly let up when a wide shouldered brown makes a run down stream and tighten it up at the moment you want to make your move. The lightweight sleek design adds a level of finese and bad-assery to any rig and gives you the confidence to stalk those big dark shadows across the way.
customer_reviews.author: Ashtyn Heninger

customer_reviews.title: Out of the package it seems to be a very nice reel. No issues with the machining that I ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 3/4wt model and have not fished it yet. Out of the package it seems to be a very nice reel. No issues with the machining that I can see. I put a double taper 4wt line on it and hardly used any backing at all to fill the reel which won’t be an issue as I’m not fishing for anything that’ll need backing. Wouldn’t hesitate to purchase another unless this one has some issues on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Myers

customer_reviews.title: Ready for the next season...
customer_reviews.text: Since I received this reel during winter, I haven't fished with it yet. That being said, I have gone out in the snow and cast the thing extensively. It seems mechanically sound, has a silent reel retrieve, and a slightly audible drag. It handles very smoothly. The drag adjustment is a dial that works great and can apply specific tension. I would recommend this item. -Daniel J. Rice, author of THIS SIDE OF A WILDERNESS, and THE UNPEOPLED SEASON.
customer_reviews.author: Woodsman

customer_reviews.title: Quality reel for freshwater
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the reel is exceptional at this price point. The action is smooth and the drag sufficient for freshwater. The weight of the reel is very light. I would buy another one if I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: John Trahan

customer_reviews.title: + $  vs  -$
customer_reviews.text: Once I receive the reel I will check out the quality. After I return from Cuba I will let you know how well it works compared to my Tibors. This is an experiment for me to see if real quality can be built at a very affordable price....
customer_reviews.author: Bill Humes

customer_reviews.title: Drag dial too sensitive!!
customer_reviews.text: If you happen to accidently touch the drag dial while casting, fighting a fish or what ever, the next time you go to strip out line you will get a birds nest!! Took this to Wyoming with me last week and I can't tell you how many times this happened. If you set the drag where you want it all it takes is one small touch to go from a fairly snug drag to a free wheel. And there is no way to notice this unless you check it before and after EVERY cast!!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Piscifun Fly Reel
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely beautiful reel, with an exceptional drag system, to fish even the lightest tippets. There is plenty of spool capacity for both the fly line and the backing. The reel is built to take a beating, which for me is great since I am tough on equipment. The only possible issue could be the physical weight of the reel, it is heavier than the high priced reels and could make balancing a problem if you are using lightweight fly rods. I fish a 40 year old 7-wt (9 ft) bamboo/fiberglass composite rod and this reel totally compliments the rod. This reel is built to last forever. FISH ON
customer_reviews.author: herb beier

customer_reviews.title: Very Smooth Drag System
customer_reviews.text: Well balanced reel, very smooth drag. I am very pleased with the quality of this reel especially how reasonable the price is.It might not be a big name company but the quality is as good as many of those very expansive "name" brands. I have fished all over the North American continent and am looking forward to using this reel on my next Alaska trip.
customer_reviews.author: Bob L.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Reel spindle flexes under pressure for large fish and it is possible to get your fly line snarled. I wouldn’t buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Paul F Chirdon

customer_reviews.title: Great reel
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of posts about this reel, I usually use high end reels that cost many more times than this reel. I am here to tell you I will start buying this reel and save a lot of money. I fished this reel today and was amazed at the quality and and easy drag adjustment. I am ordering a couple more of these reels in other weights.
customer_reviews.author: Hudman76

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Fly Reel
customer_reviews.text: As a veteran fly fisher I am always looking for quality gear. This reel has been on my list for a while. The craftsmanship and quality is amazing. I will be matching it up with one of my 6 weight rods. The drag is smooth and solid... No wobble or play. The finish is flawless. This reel easily compares to reels which are many times more costly. I hope to purchase another for my son.
customer_reviews.author: CGoss

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: Anyone interested,Piscifun Sword reel is a reel winner not to heavy not to light.The 7/8 wt is capable of holding ample backing as well as a shooting line with ,a shooting head.Smooth retrieve, enough drag for trout fishing.A real bargin in todays arena of manufactures.Love the assorted colors.Try one, I can't see you being disappointed.No negatives from this fisherman.I will purchase again....5 stars....Thankyou for a great product Thomas Perry Ca.......
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R Perry

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Nice Finish and Function!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit uncertain what to expect but the reviews looked good. This is a beautiful reel that functions as good as it looks. It is a rare find for a fly reel at this price point. Equal to a $200 or more reel... easily. Extremely nice finishing and a solid, smooth feel. Very nice precision click drag adjustment. Perfect choice to refresh my grandpa's bamboo rod!
customer_reviews.author: D. Clapp

customer_reviews.title: Reel Review
customer_reviews.text: Obviously a cork drag system is not as effective as some of the high end carbon fiber drag systems on more expensive reels, but aside from that this reel stands up to the high end reels in regards to durability and quality. For the price, this is the best reel I've used. Any disadvantages of this reel's drag systems can be overcome by slightly changing your technique. Well worth the buy considering the cost difference. Save your money for a high end fly line, not reel and rod. My 2 cents
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight reel at a great price. I’m hooked!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this reel, and I am very impressed so far. I like the color, which is a rose gold metallic. The retrieve is completely silent, while the drag has a very subtle yet pleasant click. The drag dial works nicely, giving a wide range of resistance. The fit is tight, with absolutely no play in the components. I hope to fish with this soon, so I will be in a position to better rate the performance/durability rating. For now I have it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Damon O.

customer_reviews.title: One day's experience.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the light weight of the reel on my new 6 weight rod. The rod and reel landed about 20 brown trout from 14"-20" with no problems or malfunctions. The drag adjustment is a little touchy but once I got it set it performed fine. In comparing the reel with other high-end reels that I own so far it has met or exceeded my expectations. I was pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: l diane wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Great reel until it got drunk.
customer_reviews.text: Had a great time with this reel until it got drunk. Had to set it down and sit on the boat for the rest of the day and enjoy the scenery. Just as good as my $150ish reel. You'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Poky208

customer_reviews.title: Might even buy a third
customer_reviews.text: Nice smooth action. This is part of my saltwater fly fishing rig. I liked it so much I bought the 3/4 for my orvis rod.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: this reel is great. smooth operation with an excellent drag. I feel like I got a real good product for a fantastic price. I already used this reel on Puget sound for sea run cutthroat trout. Love it
customer_reviews.author: facemask

customer_reviews.title: This reel seems exceptionally good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This reel seems exceptionally good quality for the price. I was pleasantly surprised at how solid and well performing it felt right out of the box, and after using it I only feel better. While I have not yet caught a monster that could really test it, it has worked perfectly on the average size fish I have caught. I am so pleased in fact that there is another Piscifun reel, and a spare spool for this reel in my Amazon cart right now which will be purchased next month. I highly recommend these reels to anyone from beginner to experienced fly fisher.
customer_reviews.author: Andy T

customer_reviews.title: Very good deal. I've used it 3 times since I ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good deal. I've used it 3 times since I received it. Two of those times during very cold weather and the reel performed flawlessly. It is fairly small, but then again I ordered a 3-4 wt reel. I ordered backing and line from Piscifun as well and it all matches really well. Good value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: JJM

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable quality
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down and got a new fly reel as my old one broke a couple of years ago and I've been fishing without a drag. I really like the new real, it is solid built, and works as advertised. I liked the affordability and the quality is good. Overall I'd recommend this product, it's not a replacement for a very high end reel but it is a good real and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stocek

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Just received my size 3/4 reel in Space Gray finish. Fit and finish are top notch, operation is in fact silky smooth, including the drag. Have not caught any fish with it yet. The "space gray" is an attractive light titanium-like color. Looks a lot more expensive than $50. 50 yards of #20 backing. and a 3 weight RIO Intouch Perception line(80 feet) fill it up. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: SmokieOkie

customer_reviews.title: Nice real at great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this real for wife's 3# rod It balanced out great smooth and drag is good and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Donald R.

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome reel. I loved the first one so much ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome reel. I loved the first one so much that I bought a second one for my other fly rod. The drag is smooth the reel performs beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the price
customer_reviews.text: Dang. For the money this is a great reel! I haven’t caught a fish on it so take it for what it’s worth. The build is phenomenal though and everything functions every bit as good as the higher end reels I’ve used. If you’re on the fence, just buy it. You won’t have any regret.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Miller

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING
customer_reviews.text: I WAS SO AMAZED !! I couldn't wait to receive my new reel and when I did receive it I was not disappointed , A great quality real for an unbelievable price !! I have multiple high end and this reell totally fits the bill for 1/4 of the price, i'm confident that I will be purchasing more in different sizes , I will be heading to the upper Peninsula in Michigan for 10 days of nonstop uninterrupted trout fishing I can't wait to try my new reel .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Super surprised on the build quality of this reel. Got it for my wife's 9' 5wt, great balance, drag, and click. She loves the look. Only one season in so far so durability is still a question mark, but for the price I like it better than some mid range Echo or Reddington stuff for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Sweet reel at twice the price
customer_reviews.text: Fished this 7/8 earlier today for 1st time, and I'm still impressed. Excellent fit and finish
customer_reviews.author: mate4

customer_reviews.title: The tolerance on this reel are great, super smooth and drag strong
customer_reviews.text: Second reel from Piscifun. The tolerance on this reel are great, super smooth and drag strong. I use this real for bass fishing so I can't tell you how it would hold up in the salt, but anodization looks good and even. For the money it is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Roverrich

customer_reviews.title: Great size for a large arbor
customer_reviews.text: So far so good will know much more in the future but as of now very happy with the reel
customer_reviews.author: Roger Baer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality drag system. Not good.
customer_reviews.text: Drag is terrible/non existent. Reel looks good but was nothing but frustration on the water. I would not recommend this reel.
customer_reviews.author: Summedic

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent reel for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent reel for the money. The drag has to be checked every now and then to make sure the drag knob hasn't adjusted itself by being bumped into. That is the only flaw I can think of. It's​ a minor detail that they could fix pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: ghost5849

customer_reviews.title: Lota Bang 4 Buck
customer_reviews.text: Excellent light weight trout reel...Superb price.. Speaking from someone who owns Hardys and Orvis. predominately with over 50 years of fly-fishing experience.. No need to spend big bucks on a small trout reel -- unless your goal is to impress your fellow buddies.. If that your goal stay with Abel, Tibor or Hatch..
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Good value at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Reel appearance is good. The mechanisms are alittle tight. For the money it will work great for the casual weekend fly fisher.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive drag dial. No clicks.
customer_reviews.text: Great reel for the money. Very sensitive drag dial, goes from heavy to light in a partial turn. Bump it to nothing and then strip your line out and you will bird nest your real. Happened to me today. But, for the money it’s a good deal. Great finish,
customer_reviews.author: Art4bux

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, beautiful reel
customer_reviews.text: I love the free wheel action and drag system. I fish for smaller trout so the drag is not that inpmportant. I easily changed from right to left handed. The reel feel quality, held my new DT4F and backing nicely. I have an LL Bean Pocket Rod in 7.5 feet that’s waiting to hit the streams.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Slizewski

customer_reviews.title: Drag system cannot be adjusted
customer_reviews.text: Reel looks nice and solid, with good feel and good machining. The only downsize is the drag, which cannot be adjusted. It is fully tight or loose. This is not acceptable when fishing for bigger fish.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice reel for the price. Replaced an old phlueger reel that 30 years ago cost twice as much and so far this is a smoother reel with better drag adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Craig E.

customer_reviews.title: no complaints!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Drag is good and looks great on a green rod with blue fly line. looks and feels much pricey than it sells for.
customer_reviews.author: Kaden Avery Milkovich

customer_reviews.title: nice needs more drag
customer_reviews.text: Made well, nice finish, I cannot adjust the drag well enough to appropriately limit the amount of line that comes out each time but it is definitely nice
customer_reviews.author: M. Green

customer_reviews.title: My new top reel
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight, smooth to let line in and out. The drag doesn't click when pulling line out, which took some getting used to. The overall appearance is awesome! Who else makes a green and silver reel like this and sells it for this price? Nobody, that's who.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Vaeth

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Reel for the price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little Reel..Didn't need to break the bank...Used it the last three days without any problems (about 8 hours each day)...We'll see how it holds up...Would recommend for a novice fly fisherman who doesn't want to invest a huge amount in trying to figure out if Fly fishing is for you!!
customer_reviews.author: Computational I.

customer_reviews.title: Love this reel so much I bought another one
customer_reviews.text: Quality construction, high end features and a great price. What more do you want? I bought this reel to match my piscifun 4pc 4 wt rod and liked it so much, I bought another one for my 3wt rod. Works well, great balance, smooth and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: TED T.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Quite surprisingly nice for the price. Fit and finish are what you'd expect from a much more expensive reel. Drag is smooth with good range of adjustment. Impressed!
customer_reviews.author: JWV

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 7/8 wt. Sword fly fishing reel for my son but dad's taken a liking to this reel. Smooth drag and handling has made it fun to use on our unique oxbow lakes, or Resacas here in Deep South Texas. We are also only a 30 minute drive from the Gulf of Mexico. There are plenty of saltwater species such as Redfish, Speckled Trout and Snook for this little reel to handle. The build is solid and feels like a more expensive type machined fly reel. For the money and the quality, you just can't beat the Piscifun Sword fly fishing reel.
customer_reviews.author: PH Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reel, touchy drag
customer_reviews.text: This reel is awesome for the price! Looks sharp and is smooth all around. For anyone wondering this reel is sealed to keep dirt and grit out, which is a huge plus. The only reason I'm rating 4 stars instead of 5 is because of how touchy the drag is, but that's not a huge selling point for me, just something to be aware of. Awesome job Piscifun, i will be ordering again soon.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Romani

customer_reviews.title: Great reel
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the price, no issues using it as well. I have been fly fishing for 40 years and have used many reels, this one is impressive yet very basic.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I am fully pleased and was totally surprised to find such a high quality reel for this very affordable price. Delivery was on time, and I found simple instructions on line for reversing the reel for L/H retrieve which took only a minute or two to perform. Once spooled with line I found the reel performs as well as those of much greater cost. I am totally satisfice, and I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: BocaMike

customer_reviews.title: ... this price range but the Piscifun Sword is definitely better quality. I like the Piscifun Sword so much ...
customer_reviews.text: I have other fly rod reels in this price range but the Piscifun Sword is definitely better quality. I like the Piscifun Sword so much I just bought the Piscifun Blaze as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Fife

customer_reviews.title: An excellent reel at a great price - outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: This is my second review of the product, because I have now bought two of them. First was a 5/6.and now a 7/8. Both very high quality and a great value. Inadvertently ordered a Piscifun Blaze. Decent reel, but this CNC machined product is much more solid, and worth the extra $20 or so. Sent the Blaze back and got another Sword.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis M. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: the reel operates smoothly and easily, and it functions just as well as my ...
customer_reviews.text: Completely surprised by this product. The machining and fitment is first rate, the reel operates smoothly and easily, and it functions just as well as my far more expensive reels. The drag is smooth, and repeatable, and the thing just looks really nice hanging off my (far more expensive) rod. A great value. I'll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality reel for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely machined quality reel (3/4 weight). When I received it, the reel seat was misaligned with the body, but I was able to remedy that quickly. It’ a really nice match for my 7 1/2 foot rod. Silky smooth with a nice drag...
customer_reviews.author: Eric J.

customer_reviews.title: 'Pink' one is a rose gold color. Love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this so I haven't had a chance to actually test it out, but I love what I see so far! Looks well made and like it will stand up to fishing in the PNW. FYI the pink is actually more of a rose gold color. Very pretty!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great reel, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this reel for my daughter's first fly rod set up. The reel is very good quality. Nicely machined and the drag is very smooth. I will definitely consider Piscifun products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Dale S.

customer_reviews.title: Best value IMO.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an entry-level fly guy and can't speak to reels in the hundreds of dollars and more class. All I know is I love this reel on my TFL Essox, 9' 300-400 gr. rod for pike and bass. It spools well, has a good drag system and is all-around smooth in its action.
customer_reviews.author: Buck50

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel Buy It
customer_reviews.text: I have the 7/8 and have fished on it for 3 seasons now. I use it primarily for carping. It has taken quite a beating and still is going strong. I've pulled in over 100 carp on it easily all of which I have fought on the reel. Its even taken a beating from a handful of 20 lb+ carp that took me anywhere from 70-150 yards into my backing. It's a good reel. Buy it you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fly Reel for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice smooth drag, easy to convert right-to-left retrieve, nicely finished.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Arnold

customer_reviews.title: It's a great price for a very well made reel.
customer_reviews.text: First off I could not find anything I didn't like about this reel. I like the fill and weight of and being able to free hand the reel. It has a great finish on it and is worth the money I paid for it . I would highly recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: larry fetterman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful dealings with Piscifun
customer_reviews.text: Recently I ordered and had delivered one of many Piscifun Sword Fly fishing reels. As this is my 5th Piscifun reel, I was not surprised by the care and attention to detail the staff at Piscifun provided me. The reel is perfect! The shipping and packaging was great. And as always the people are terrific!
customer_reviews.author: William Wolff

product_meta.title: Piscifun Sword Fly Fishing Reel with CNC-machined Aluminum Alloy Body 3/4, 5/6, 7/8, 9/10 Weights(Black, Gunmetal, Pink, Space Gray)
feature_bullets: THREE-YEAR WARRANTY - Your reel has been set at the factory for left-hand retrieve. To convert your reel to right-hand retrieve, please contact us for guidance.
SILKY SMOOTH DRAG - Multi-disc cork and stainless steel drag system with one-way clutch bearing for smooth immediate drag engagement. Accurate click drag and silent retrieve.
SOLID and LIGHT WEIGHT - Precision CNC-machined 6061-T6 aluminum alloy for high-impact durability; Larger CNC hollow design makes the reel lighter than ordinary ones.
CORROSION RESISTANCE - Hard anodized for surface protection increases abrasion resistance and weather fastness; Cold forged and tempered for superior strength and rigidity.
Mid-ARBOR DESIGN - Reducing line memory while also facilitating lightning-quick line pickup.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
